Question.quest: Trinidad was colonized by which country before the english?
Question.fact: Before being under British rule, Trinidad was colonized by the spanish between 1498 and 1797

Question.quest: How many hills are there in San Fernando?
Question.fact: The Naparima Hill otherwise known as the San Fernando Hill is a 192-m Hill which lies at the centre of the city of San Fernando in Trinidad & Tobago

Question.quest: What is the number for the ambulance in Trinidad & Tobago?
Question.fact: To contact the Fire and Ambulance servcies dail 990

Question.quest: Who was the Prime Minister in 2004?
Question.fact: Former political leader of the People's National Movement (PNM) Patrick Augustus Mervyn Manning having terms from 17 December 1991 to 9 November 1995 and from 24 December 2001 to 26 May 2010

Question.quest: Who gave San Fernando its current city name?
Question.fact: The last spanosh governor of trinidad was Don Jose Maria Chacon. He was responsible for signing the cedula of population in 1783 and founding the city of San Fernando

Question.quest: What you do when bored?
Who is the first president of Tobago?
Question.fact: Ellis Emmanuel Innocent Clarke was the second and last Governor-General and was unamimously elected as president when Trinidad & Tobago became a Republic in 1976

Question.quest: Who founded the United National Congress (UNC)?
Question.fact: On the first anniversary of CLUB 88, Basdeo Panday unveiled the symbol and announced the creation of the UNC Party at the Declaration of Aranguez on October 16, 1988.

Question.quest: Who wrote the National Anthem?
Question.fact: The National Anthem was written to celebrate Trinidad and Tobago's independence from Great Britain on August 31, 1962. A nation-wide contest was held in search of the best anthem to accompany this momentous occasion. The winner of the contest was Patrick Stanisclaus Castagne.

Question.quest: What are the National Birds of Trinidad & Tobago?
Who founded the People's National Movement (PNM)?
Question.fact: Sir Eric Williams founded the PNM in 1955. They won the 1956 General Elections and went on to hold power for an unbroken 30 years.

Question.quest: What year did George Bovell win Olympic Gold?
How many Miss Universe titles have Trinidad & Tobago won?
Question.fact: Janelle a.k.a. Penny Commissiong - 1977 & Wendy Fitzwilliam - 1998.

Question.quest: What street is the Port of Spain Hospital on?
Question.fact: Port of Spain General Hospital was constructed in 1855.

Question.quest: When did we celebrate our first independence in T&T?
Question.fact: At midnight on the 30th August 1962, the Union Jack (British Flag) was lowered and the T&T flag raised for the first time.

Question.quest: Who was the first female to win Calypso Monarch in T&T?
Question.fact: Calypso Rose (Mcartha Sandy-Lewis) won in 1978 with 'Her Majesty' as tune #1 & 'I Thank Thee' as tune #2.

Question.quest: What was the first capital of T&T?
Question.fact: Originally named San Jose de Oruna it served as the capital of Spanish Trinidad between 1592 & 1783.

Question.quest: When was the coup in T&T?
Question.fact: The Jamaat al Muslimeen (lead by Abu Bakr) carried out an armed invasion in an attempt to overthrow the local government on July 27th 1990. This lasted for 6 days.

Question.quest: Which bird is on the $20 bill?
Question.fact: $1 - Scarlet Ibis, $5 - Mot Mot, $10 - Cocrico, $20 - Humming Bird, $50 - Red-Capped Cardinal, $100 - Bird of Paradise.

Question.quest: Which bird is on the $50 bill?
Question.fact: $1 - Scarlet Ibis, $5 - Mot Mot, $10 - Cocrico, $20 - Humming Bird, $50 - Red-Capped Cardinal, $100 - Bird of Paradise.

Question.quest: Which bird is on the $100 bill?
Question.fact: $1 - Scarlet Ibis, $5 - Mot Mot, $10 - Cocrico, $20 - Humming Bird, $50 - Red-Capped Cardinal, $100 - Bird of Paradise.

Question.quest: Who was the 3rd Prime Minister of T&T?
Question.fact: ANR Robinson became the 3rd Prime Minister in T&T in 1986.

Question.quest: Which Trinidadian won the nobel prize in literature?
Question.fact: V.S Naipaul won the nobel prize in 2001.

Question.quest: What is the name of the highway in Tobago?
Question.fact: Claude Noel is a former tobagonian professional boxer, who held the WBA World Lightweight title and the Commonwealth Lightweight title.

Question.quest: In what year did Hasely Crawford win olympic gold?
Question.fact: Hasely Crawford became T&T's first olympic champion & the first olympic 100m champion from a caribbean country in 1976.

Question.quest: How many times has Patrick Manning been Prime Minister?
Question.fact: Patrick Manning held office from 1991 - 1995, 2001 - 2005 & again 2005 - 2010.

Question.quest: What is the national symbol of T&T?
Question.fact: T&T's Coat of Arms was designed by a designated committee including artists such as Carlyle Chang & George Bailey.

Question.quest: Who is the only person to serve as Prime Minister & President of T&T?
Question.fact: ANR Robinson was the 3rd president serving 1997 - 2003 & 3rd prime minister serving 1986 - 1991.

Question.quest: What does the black on the National Flag symbolize?
Question.fact: The flag was chosen by the independence committee in 1962. Red, Black & White represent fire, earth & water.

Question.quest: How many Soca Monarch titles does Super Blue have?
Question.fact: Austin Lyons aka Super Blue became infamous from his first foray into the calypso tent world in 1980 with 'Soca Baptiste'.

Question.quest: Brian Lara holds the highest individual score, in first-class cricket, with how many runs not out?
Question.fact: In 1994, Brian Charles Lara achieved the highest first-class score in cricket history, 501 not out. He surpassed Hanif Mohammed's 499.

Question.quest: Where is the largest desposit of asphalt in T&T?
Question.fact: The La Brea Pitch :ake was discovered by Sir Walter Raleigh in 1595. It is the world's largest natural deposit of emilsified asphalt.

Question.quest: Which soca artist has the most Road March titles?
Question.fact: Lord Kitchener has won 12 Road March titles.

Question.quest: What is the only musicsl instrument invented in the 20th Century?
Question.fact: The Steel Pan was created in the 1930's.

Question.quest: Who is the 7th prime minister of T&T?
Question.fact: Keith Rowley won the elections in 2015, becoming the 7th Prime Minister of T&T.

Question.quest: Who was the 6th Prime Minister of T&T?
Question.fact: Kamla Persad-Bissessar won the elections in 2010, becoming the 6th Prime Minister of T&T.

Question.quest: In what year was the most recent 'state of emergency' in T&T?
Question.fact: On August 22st 2011, Prime Minister at the time Kamla Persad-Bissessar declare a nation wide State of Emergency.

Question.quest: Which swamp is the largest swamp in T&T?
Question.fact: The Nariva Swamp was declared to be a forrest reserve in 1954 & is the largest freshwater wetland in T&T.

Question.quest: What year did Christopher Colombus rediscover Trinidad?
Question.fact: Christopher Colombus landed on our shores on his third voyage of exploration.

Question.quest: Where is the President's house located?
Question.fact: The President's house was built between 1873 & 1876.

Question.quest: What are the colours of the maxis in T&T?
choice: Red, Yellow, Blue, Black, Green, Brown,
Question.fact: North - Yellow, Red. South - Brown, Green & Black. Tobago - Blue.

Question.quest: How many maxi bands/colors does T&T have?
Question.fact: North - Yellow, Red. South - Brown, Green & Black. Tobago - Blue.

Question.quest: Which statue is located in Independence Square, PoS?
Question.fact: Capt. Cipriani was a T&T labour leader & polotician. He founded the Trinidad Labour Party.

Question.quest: What year did T&T qualify for the World Cup?
Question.fact: The T&T 'Soca Warriors' reached the first round of the 2006 Fifa World Cup. We currently hold the record as the smallest nation to ever qualify for a Fifa World Cup.

Question.quest: What year was the reconstructed airport opened?
Question.fact: A major expansion of the airport, including the construction of a new terminal building, was completed in 2001. The old airport is used for cargo handling.

Question.quest: What is the national flower of T&T?
Question.fact: The Chaconia is titled in honor of the last spanish governor of T&T, Don Jose Maria Chacon.

Question.quest: What does CNC3 stand for?
Question.fact: CNC3 was founded on Friday 26th September, 2005.

Question.quest: What year did Anthony Carmona begin his presidency?
Question.fact: Anthony Carmona is currently president, dated from Mach 18th 2013.

Question.quest: What is the name of the National Museum?
Question.fact: The Museum was established in 1892 as The Royal Victoria Institute.

Question.quest: Which is closer to Trinidad?
Question.fact: The distance from Trinidad to Venezuela is 757.16 Km.

Question.quest: How many gold medalists does Trinidad have?
Question.fact: Hasely Crawford - 1976. Keshawn Walcott - 2012.
